headline.main: EUROPE.; OPERATIONS IN INDIA AND CHINA. Cotton and Breadstuffs Dull-Provisions Drooping. Further Outbreaks in Asiatic Turkey. ARRIVAL OF THE PERSIA. THE TELEGRAPHIC ENTERPRISE. PASSAGE OF THE INDIA BILL. Final Passage of the Oaths Bill through the House of Commons,

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamer Persia, C. H. E. JUDKINS, Esq., commander, from Liverpool at 9 o'clock on Saturday, the 24th ult., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The steamship City of Baltimore, from Halifax on the 11th July, arrived out at Liverpool at 11 o'clock P.M. on the 22d.

headline.main: The Rutland Free-Lovers--A Chance Make Money.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. JOHN LANDON is a merchant in the town of Hutland, Vt. He is possessed of means and infuence, and has lately sprung into celebrity. Through his active efforts, the late "Convention" at Butland found facilities for holding its meetings, when other people in the town turned their backs upon it, and the Free-Lovers cherish a warm regard for him for the good-will he exhibited. His specialty, however, is Spiritualism,

headline.main: UTA H.; General Description of Salt Lake Valley. VIEW OF MORMON AFFAIRS Narrative of an American Citizen held as a Prisoner of War.

docs.abstract: Return of Brigham to Salt Lake
docs.lead_paragraph: OENERAL VIEW OF THE SALT LAKE VALLEY. There has been no other time, during many years, probably, in which the valleys of tile mountains could have been viewed by a stranger to so great an advantage as tile present. You are already aware that your correspondent emerged from the Wasatch Mountains to the great table overlooking Salt Lake in the midst of a severe rain storm.

docs.snippet: FRASER'S RIVER EMIGRATION.--The steamer Moses Taylor of the Pacific Mail line, Captain MoGOWAN, will leave this port on Thursday, the 5th inst., with a full complement of passengers. The low fare (only $160 in the steerage) which is charged by this...
docs.lead_paragraph: FRASER'S RIVER EMIGRATION.--The steamer Moses Taylor of the Pacific Mail line, Captain MoGOWAN, will leave this port on Thursday, the 5th inst., with a full complement of passengers. The low fare (only $160 in the steerage) which is charged by this line during July and August contributes, with the excitement concerning the new gold discoveries, to fill these steamers long before the day of sailing.

docs.lead_paragraph: We publish, this morning, another very interesting letter from our Correspondent in Utah, but of an earlier date than those given in the TIMES of Friday and Saturday-the mail arrangement, being still defective, and the regular transmission of correspondence consequently uncartain. headline.main: EUROPE.; The Royal Visit to the Continent, INTERESTING DEBATES IN PARLIAMENT, ARRIVAL OF THE VANDERBILT. Passage of the New-Caledonia Bill in the Bouse of Commons. Sailing of the Telegraphic Fleet

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Vanderbilt, P. E. LE FEVRE, Esq., Commander, from Havre, on the 21st, and Southampton on the 22d ult., arrived at this port yesterday morning at 5 o'clock. She brings 245 passengers, an unusually large cargo and the European mails. The weather throughout the passage was quite favorable to laying the Atlantic cable.

docs.snippet: THE ASSESSMENT ROLLS.--The Board of Assessors confirmed the Assessment Rolls for 1858 las Saturday The Common Council have adopted a rule that all corrections must be made before the rolls are closed, unless the delinquents can sho , by affidavit,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ASSESSMENT ROLLS.--The Board of Assessors confirmed the Assessment Rolls for 1858 las Saturday The Common Council have adopted a rule that all corrections must be made before the rolls are closed, unless the delinquents can sho , by affidavit, sufficient reason for not appearing at the proper time, or that the correction asked for was the error of the Assessors, committed by them after the time allowed for correction.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; CONSOLS 95 1-2@95 5-8. [By the Newfoundland and American Telegraph Company's Line --Office No. 21 Wall-street.] COTTON STEADY-BREADSTUFFS FIRM. The Persia (Probably) Off Cape Race Chinese Fort at the Mouth of the Pei-ho Taken by the Allies. LATER FROM EUROPE. Gwalior Recaptured by the British Forces. IMPORTANT FROM INDIA AND CHINA.

docs.lead_paragraph: A steamer from Europe passed Cape Race at about noon, yesterday, and handed to a fisherman four copies of the Liverpool Northern Times, from the 20th to the 23d July, inclusive. Tile name was riot ascertained, and the customary dispatch from our agent in Liverpool having failed to come to hand, we are unable to say what vessel it was
